ratings.question_text: Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: We also had a couple days where we did work instead of live class.
We met Monday through Thursday via zoom for over an hour each class period

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I continued my progress in Polish.
Increased knowledge of polish vocabulary, grammar, and culture.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Loved the teacher, she is so sweet and dedicated to teaching Polish. I liked learning more about the language and advancing my skills.
The strength of this course was that there were only 6 students, so the feedback was very personal in class. There was a lot of discussion in class rather than just sitting and being talked at.
The strength is that Professor Krystyna is great and she makes the class enjoyable. The weakness is that the class was small in numbers.
The smaller class size allowed for a very high level of engagement and feedback. A greater variety in the coursework, perhaps through more presentations, could be beneficial.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Everyday was the same, we would have class for an hour and would go through the textbook. It was really the same as when things were normal, and she did a great job.
This was a successful class in terms of virtual learning.
The homework and lessons translated very well. I felt that engagement was actually higher than it was before COVID.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Yes. I think it is a very interesting language that did not take too much of a burden on my schedule. The classes were light and fun, there was very little stress about homework or exams. I had a really good experience.
Yes I would. Its very fun and Professor Krystyna is great.

Yes. Polish is challenging but taught very well. Clear feedback is given on every assignment as well as any subsequent corrected versions. The discussions on Polish politics, current events, and history were also fascinating.
Yes, this was a great class and others should take it
